product_overview: BockVote is a blockchain-enabled voting platform designed to provide secure, transparent, and decentralized election management and vote casting. Utilizing a Flutter frontend with a Go-based blockchain backend, it ensures integrity, real-time results, and a user-friendly voting experience across multiple platforms.
core_goals: Ensure secure user authentication and role-based access control.
Enable creation, management, and configuration of elections with candidates and voting rules.
Provide a seamless and secure voting interface with vote confirmation and offline capability.
Deliver real-time election results with analytics and visualization.
Integrate project-specific blockchain technology for vote verification and transaction security.
Offer administrative tools for election and user management, system monitoring, and reporting.
Ensure responsive and cross-platform compatibility including mobile, web, and desktop.
Implement robust security, performance, and scalability standards to support high user volume and maintain election integrity.
key_features: Complete authentication system with login, registration, password management, and token handling with biometric support.
Election management interface allowing creation, configuration, and administration of elections and candidates.
User-friendly voting interface featuring candidate selection, vote confirmation, and offline voting capabilities.
Real-time results display with interactive charts, analytics, vote verification, and export functionality.
Administrative dashboard for managing users, elections, monitoring system health, and generating reports.
Blockchain integration implementing a Proof-of-Authority consensus to ensure secure and verifiable voting transactions.
Advanced routing and navigation via GoRouter ensuring seamless flow throughout the app.
Responsive UI built with Material Design themes, supporting Progressive Web App features and push notifications.
Robust backend REST API covering authentication, election management, voting submissions, real-time WebSocket communication, and admin endpoints.
Comprehensive testing framework including integration, security penetration, performance, and cross-platform compatibility tests.
user_flow_summary: User Registration and Login: Users register or login using a secure authentication flow with support for role-based access and biometric authentication.
Election Browsing: Users view available elections with filtering, searching, and detailed candidate information.
Voting Process: Users select candidates, confirm votes securely, receive receipts, and can vote offline if needed.
Results Viewing: Users access real-time election results, interact with charts, verify votes, and export data.
Admin Operations: Admins log in to manage elections, create new elections, manage users, monitor system status, and view analytics.
Blockchain Synchronization: Backend processes ensure blockchain and traditional database synchronization with conflict resolution.
Real-time Updates: WebSocket connections provide users and admins with instant notifications on vote counts and election statuses.
System Monitoring and Maintenance: Continuous backend monitoring, logging, and update mechanisms maintain system health and security.
validation_criteria: Authentication flows must be tested to ensure secure access and role enforcement.
Election creation and management interfaces must enforce data integrity and validation rules.
Voting process must securely record votes on the blockchain, verify transactions, and confirm vote receipts.
Results display should update in real-time with accurate charting and data exports.
Admin dashboard functionality must be fully operational, including user management and system monitoring.
Blockchain integration must pass consensus and transaction validation tests under load.
The app shall demonstrate responsive design across devices including mobile, web, and desktop.
Performance tests must validate sub-2 second vote submission response times at 10,000+ concurrent users.
Security assessments should show zero critical vulnerabilities from penetration testing.
Cross-platform testing must confirm consistent user experience on iOS, Android, web browsers, and desktop environments.
